name: Eating for Two: Tempting Wheatberry Salad for Grazing
description: Arrowhead Mills' Whole Grain Wheat (Wheatberries) Finally, happily, I’d like to tell you about something pregnant women can and should eat with no worries. In fact, everyone who is trying to work more whole grains into their diet should...
recipeYield: 4 as a snack or side dish
recipeIngredient: 2-4 ounces dried cranberries, according to taste (I like a lot of cranberries)
1/4 cup packed, minced fresh herbs or parsley

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the wheatberries in 1.5 quarts salted water, for 60 minutes or until they are soft but still chewy. Drain them in a strainer.

Add the drained, slightly cooled wheatberries to a large mixing bowl with the cranberries, red onion, and herbs or parsley. Dissolve the salt in the vinegar and pour it all over the wheatberries along with the oil. Let it sit, covered, for at least 30 minutes. Season to taste with more salt and pepper. This salad is best served at room temperature.
